SCHEDULE  
 
  

 
Page 2 of 2 
 THE  DORMANT FUNDS (ADMINISTRATION) ACT, 1966  
ACT No. XX OF 1966  
[19th December,  1966 ] 
An Act to provide for the administration of certain dormant funds and matters connected therewith  
WHEREAS certain funds raised by public subscriptions and donations have bee n lying 
dormant ;  
AND WHEREAS it is expedient to make provision for the administration and proper utilization 
and disposal of those funds ;  
AND WHEREAS the national interest of Pakistan in relation to the achievement of uniformity 
within the meaning of cla use (2) of Article 131 of the Constitution requires Central Legislation in the 
matter ;  
It is hereby enacted as follows : — 
1. Short title and commencement .__ (1) This Act may be called the Dormant Funds 
(Administration) Act, 1966.  
(2)  It shall come into force at once.  
2. Vesting of dormant funds in the President and their utilisation. — (1) 
Notwithstanding  anything contained in any other law or instrument, the funds specified in the 
Schedule, together with interest and profit accruing thereon, shall vest f orthwith in the President.  
(2) The amounts in the aforesaid funds, other than that in the Palestine Aid Fund, shall be 
transferred to the President ’s Relief Fund instituted on the 16th May, 1965, and shall be utilised for 
purposes of relief or for purposes  as nearly as possible, to those for which they were raised.  
(3) The amount in the Palestine Aid Fund shall be utilised for the Palestine cause.  
___________  
 
THE SCHEDULE  
Name of the Fund  Rs. 
(1) Quaid­e­Azam Bihar Relief Fund  41,82,659.33  
(2) Palestine  Aid Fund  7,06,151.36  
(3) Prime Minister's Refugee Hut Building Fund  3,09,254.30  
(4) Pakistan Fund  6,00,000.00  
(5) Muslim League Fund (India)  6,00,000.00
